item.title: Capital and funding
item.description: Banking operations are being rewired around XVA metrics, quantifying market incompleteness. Here Claudio Albanese, Simone Caenazzo and Stéphane Crépey focus on the cost of funding of variation margin and the cost of capital: that is, funding valuation adjustment (FVA) and capital valuation adjustment (KVA). Motivated by Basel Pillar 2, Solvency II and IFRS 4 Phase II, they propose a principled approach to accounting regulatory treatments for FVA and KVA, arguing the two are intertwined since economic capital is itself a source of funding
